extendedIngredients.name: cayenne pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 or two pinches of cayenne pepper, more if you'd like it spicy

extendedIngredients.name: italian sausages
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound Italian sausages, casings removed (sweet or spicy)

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons grated Asiago, Pecorino-Romano, or Parmesan cheese, plus additional for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: peperoncini
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup sliced peperoncini plus 1/2 cup liquid from jar

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes

extendedIngredients.name: heat-safe oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon heat-safe oil (like coconut or grapeseed)

recipes.title: Chicken and Sausage Peperoncini Stew (Slow Cooker)

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage to the pan and brown, stirring frequently, breaking up large chunks. Transfer to a 4-quart slow cooker. (It doesn't have to be cooked all the way through -- just get some color on it.)Turn the heat up to high and add chicken chunks. Brown the chicken quickly (again, doesn't have to be cooked through). Transfer chicken and any juices into the slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients (except for the cream and cheese) into the slow cooker and give it a quick stir. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or high for 2-3 hours. Add cream during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Sprinkle cheese over the top and add more for garnish, if desired. Serve over pasta, rice, mashed potatoes, quinoa, or zucchini noodles.

steps.step: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sausage to the pan and brown, stirring frequently, breaking up large chunks.

Transfer to a 4-quart slow cooker. (It doesn't have to be cooked all the way through -- just get some color on it.)Turn the heat up to high and add chicken chunks. Brown the chicken quickly (again, doesn't have to be cooked through).
Transfer chicken and any juices into the slow cooker.
Add remaining ingredients (except for the cream and cheese) into the slow cooker and give it a quick stir. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or high for 2-3 hours.
Add cream during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Sprinkle cheese over the top and add more for garnish, if desired.
Serve over pasta, rice, mashed potatoes, quinoa, or zucchini noodles.
